verses.verse: Moreover Job <S%H347><s%> continued <S%H3254><s%> his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
As God <S%H410><s%> lives, <S%H2416><s%> who has taken <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> my judgment; <S%H4941><s%> and the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> who has vexed <S%H4843><s%> my soul; <S%H5315><s%>
All <S%H3605><s%> the while <S%H5750><s%> my breath <S%H5397><s%> is in me, and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> is in my nostrils; <S%H639><s%>
My lips <S%H8193><s%> shall not speak <S%H1696><s%> wickedness, <S%H5766><s%> nor <S%H518><s%> my tongue <S%H3956><s%> utter <S%H1897><s%> deceit. <S%H7423><s%>
God forbid <S%H2486><s%> that I should justify <S%H6663><s%> you: till <S%H5704><s%> I die <S%H1478><s%> I will not remove <S%H5493><s%> my integrity <S%H8538><s%> from me.

My righteousness <S%H6666><s%> I hold <S%H2388><s%> fast, and will not let it go: <S%H7503><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%> shall not reproach <S%H2778><s%> me so <S%H3605><s%> long <S%H3117><s%> as I live. <S%H3117><s%>
Let my enemy <S%H341><s%> be as the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> and he that rises <S%H6965><s%> up against me as the unrighteous. <S%H5767><s%>

For what <S%H4100><s%> is the hope <S%H8615><s%> of the hypocrite, <S%H2611><s%> though <S%H3588><s%> he has gained, <S%H1214><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> God <S%H433><s%> takes <S%H7953><s%> away <S%H7953><s%> his soul? <S%H5315><s%>
Will God <S%H410><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> his cry <S%H6818><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> trouble <S%H6869><s%> comes <S%H935><s%> on him?
Will he delight <S%H6026><s%> himself in the Almighty? <S%H7706><s%> will he always <S%H6256><s%> call <S%H7121><s%> on God? <S%H433><s%>
I will teach <S%H3384><s%> you by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God: <S%H410><s%> that which <S%H834><s%> is with the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> will I not conceal. <S%H3582><s%>
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> you yourselves have seen <S%H2372><s%> it; why <S%H4100><s%> then are you thus <S%H2088><s%> altogether vain? <S%H1891><s%>

This <S%H2088><s%> is the portion <S%H2506><s%> of a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H120><s%> with God, <S%H410><s%> and the heritage <S%H5159><s%> of oppressors, <S%H6184><s%> which they shall receive <S%H3947><s%> of the Almighty. <S%H7706><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> his children <S%H1121><s%> be multiplied, <S%H7235><s%> it is for the sword: <S%H2719><s%> and his offspring <S%H6631><s%> shall not be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with bread. <S%H3899><s%>
Those that remain <S%H8300><s%> of him shall be buried <S%H6912><s%> in death: <S%H4194><s%> and his widows <S%H490><s%> shall not weep. <S%H1058><s%>
Though <S%H518><s%> he heap <S%H6651><s%> up silver <S%H3701><s%> as the dust, <S%H6083><s%> and prepare <S%H3559><s%> raiment <S%H4403><s%> as the clay; <S%H2563><s%>
He may prepare <S%H3559><s%> it, but the just <S%H6662><s%> shall put <S%H3847><s%> it on, and the innocent <S%H5355><s%> shall divide <S%H2505><s%> the silver. <S%H3701><s%>
He builds <S%H1129><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%> as a moth, <S%H6211><s%> and as a booth <S%H5521><s%> that the keeper <S%H5341><s%> makes. <S%H6213><s%>
The rich <S%H6223><s%> man shall lie <S%H7901><s%> down, <S%H7901><s%> but he shall not be gathered: <S%H622><s%> he opens <S%H6491><s%> his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and he is not.
Terrors <S%H1091><s%> take <S%H5381><s%> hold <S%H5381><s%> on him as waters, <S%H4325><s%> a tempest <S%H5492><s%> steals <S%H1589><s%> him away in the night. <S%H3915><s%>
The east <S%H6921><s%> wind carries <S%H5375><s%> him away, and he departs: <S%H3212><s%> and as a storm hurles <S%H8175><s%> him out of his place. <S%H4725><s%>
For God <S%H410><s%> shall cast <S%H7993><s%> on him, and not spare: <S%H2550><s%> he would fain <S%H1272><s%> flee <S%H1272><s%> out of his hand. <S%H3027><s%>
Men shall clap <S%H5606><s%> their hands <S%H3709><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> him, and shall hiss <S%H8319><s%> him out of his place. <S%H4725><s%>
